definitions: a weapon for shooting arrows, typically made of a curved piece of wood joined at both ends by a string
a curved piece of wood with horsehair used for playing certain stringed instruments
a knot tied with two loops and two loose ends, used especially for tying shoelaces and decorative ribbons
the forward part of the hull of a ship
examples: She played the violin with a new bow.
He tied a bow on the gift.
The pirate ship had a mermaid figurehead on the bow.
